text:
Connecting to any page but the main page of lenya from localhost results in 
error: Failed to convert address [0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1] 
 
Workaround: connect to 127.0.0.1 instead of localhost. 
 
Suse Linux 9.0 
Tomcat 4.1.27 (rmp by Suse) 
Cocoon 2.1.2 
Lenya 1.2RC2

text:
Created attachment 11588
Proposed patch to fix the IPv6 problem.

The patch fixes the Bug 2660 (IPV6 problem: unable to connect from localhost).
It has been done against the CVS HEAD revision.

The static method getAddress(String) in org.apache.lenya.ac.Machine tried to
parse the specified String as four dot-separated integers (i.e. IPv4). I
replaced the complete functionality with a call to
java.net.InetAddress.getByName(String), which works with IPv4 and IPv6 addresses
as well as DNS hostnames.

Note that I'm new to Lenya and have no idea in what context this code is called.
However, unless the use of hostnames should be forbidden (for some security
reason?), the patch should work fine.
